about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: When changing lanes, you should never:

about.name: When changing lanes, you should never:

hasPart.assesses: When changing lanes, you should never: | When changing lanes, you should never: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Before changing lanes, check for drivers trying to pass you who may be trying to enter the same lane as you. Look over your shoulder to check your blind spot. You should never attempt to pass or otherwise change lanes in an intersection.

suggestedAnswer.text: Cross the centerline in an intersection.

comment.text: Cross the centerline in an intersection.

suggestedAnswer.text: Check your blind spots by looking over your left or right shoulder.

comment.text: Check your blind spots by looking over your left or right shoulder.

suggestedAnswer.text: Check for other drivers moving into the same lane.

comment.text: Check for other drivers moving into the same lane.

acceptedAnswer.text: Cross the centerline in an intersection.

comment.text: Cross the centerline in an intersection.

answerExplanation.text: Before changing lanes, check for drivers trying to pass you who may be trying to enter the same lane as you. Look over your shoulder to check your blind spot. You should never attempt to pass or otherwise change lanes in an intersection.

comment.text: When changing lanes, you should never: | Before changing lanes, check for drivers trying to pass you who may be trying to enter the same lane as you. Look over your shoulder to check your blind spot. You should never attempt to pass or otherwise change lanes in an intersection.

hasPart.text: Drivers must use their headlights any time conditions prevent them from seeing other vehicles. Conditions with lowered visibility include dust, clouds, rain, snow, smoke, or fog on or near the roadway.

comment.text: Interior lights.
Parking lights.
Headlights.
Headlights.

answerExplanation.text: Drivers must use their headlights any time conditions prevent them from seeing other vehicles. Conditions with lowered visibility include dust, clouds, rain, snow, smoke, or fog on or near the roadway.

hasPart.assesses: When parking next to a curb, you should use your turn signals: | When parking next to a curb, you should use your turn signals: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Drivers should signal when pulling next to a curb or away from a curb.

suggestedAnswer.text: Only when pulling away from the curb.

comment.text: Only when pulling away from the curb.

suggestedAnswer.text: When pulling next to, but not away from, the curb.

comment.text: When pulling next to, but not away from, the curb.

suggestedAnswer.text: When pulling next to or away from the curb.

comment.text: When pulling next to or away from the curb.

acceptedAnswer.text: When pulling next to or away from the curb.

comment.text: When pulling next to or away from the curb.

answerExplanation.text: Drivers should signal when pulling next to a curb or away from a curb.

comment.text: When parking next to a curb, you should use your turn signals: | Drivers should signal when pulling next to a curb or away from a curb.

hasPart.name: If you want to pass a bicyclists riding on the right edge of your lane:

about.name: If you want to pass a bicyclists riding on the right edge of your lane:

hasPart.assesses: If you want to pass a bicyclists riding on the right edge of your lane: | If you want to pass a bicyclists riding on the right edge of your lane: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When passing a bicyclist, you must allow at least three feet of space between your vehicle and the bicycle whenever possible. You must not squeeze the bicyclist off the road.

suggestedAnswer.text: You must honk your horn before passing the bicyclist.

comment.text: You must honk your horn before passing the bicyclist.

suggestedAnswer.text: You must not squeeze past the bicyclist.

comment.text: You must not squeeze past the bicyclist.

suggestedAnswer.text: You may not pass the bicyclist for any reason.

comment.text: You may not pass the bicyclist for any reason.

acceptedAnswer.text: You must not squeeze past the bicyclist.

comment.text: You must not squeeze past the bicyclist.

answerExplanation.text: When passing a bicyclist, you must allow at least three feet of space between your vehicle and the bicycle whenever possible. You must not squeeze the bicyclist off the road.

hasPart.name: If you plan to pass another vehicle, you should:

about.name: If you plan to pass another vehicle, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If you plan to pass another vehicle, you should: | If you plan to pass another vehicle, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Even when you signal, you should not assume that the space you want to occupy is free or that other drivers will give you the right-of-way.

suggestedAnswer.text: Not assume the other driver will make space for you to return to your lane.

comment.text: Not assume the other driver will make space for you to return to your lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: Assume the other driver will let you pass if you use your turn signal.

comment.text: Assume the other driver will let you pass if you use your turn signal.

suggestedAnswer.text: Assume the other driver will maintain a constant speed.

comment.text: Assume the other driver will maintain a constant speed.

acceptedAnswer.text: Not assume the other driver will make space for you to return to your lane.

comment.text: Not assume the other driver will make space for you to return to your lane.

answerExplanation.text: Even when you signal, you should not assume that the space you want to occupy is free or that other drivers will give you the right-of-way.

hasPart.name: When arriving to an uncontrolled intersection at the same time as vehicles to your right and left, you should:

about.name: When arriving to an uncontrolled intersection at the same time as vehicles to your right and left, you should:

hasPart.assesses: When arriving to an uncontrolled intersection at the same time as vehicles to your right and left, you should: | When arriving to an uncontrolled intersection at the same time as vehicles to your right and left, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: If multiple vehicles arrive at the same time to an intersection that is not controlled by signs or signals, the driver on the right has the right-of-way. Drivers should then proceed in the order that they arrive to the intersection.

suggestedAnswer.text: Yield the right-of-way to the vehicle on your left.

comment.text: Yield the right-of-way to the vehicle on your left.

suggestedAnswer.text: Yield the right-of-way to the vehicle on your right.

comment.text: Yield the right-of-way to the vehicle on your right.

suggestedAnswer.text: Wait until there are no vehicles at the intersection before proceeding.

comment.text: Wait until there are no vehicles at the intersection before proceeding.

acceptedAnswer.text: Yield the right-of-way to the vehicle on your right.

comment.text: Yield the right-of-way to the vehicle on your right.

answerExplanation.text: If multiple vehicles arrive at the same time to an intersection that is not controlled by signs or signals, the driver on the right has the right-of-way. Drivers should then proceed in the order that they arrive to the intersection.

comment.text: When arriving to an uncontrolled intersection at the same time as vehicles to your right and left, you should: | If multiple vehicles arrive at the same time to an intersection that is not controlled by signs or signals, the driver on the right has the right-of-way. Drivers should then proceed in the order that they arrive to the intersection.
